column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/02/what-to-expect-from-josh-grizzard/|What To Expect From Josh Grizzard|So the Bucs have their man
column2: Josh Grizzard to run the offense. What can we expect? A lot of fans wanted “continuity.” It may not be that simple. Fans know the NFL is a copycat league. Defenses have all offseason to study a team’s offense
column4: and how to stop it. So in reality
column5: “continuity” is sort of a bad thing. The league catches up too quickly. Bucs coach Todd Bowles has often said he changes up things regularly on defense for that very purpose (maybe he doesn’t do enough?). So a few weeks into the season
column6: Grizzard’s offense should be pretty well understood. Could the Bucs offense be just as lethal? Perhaps
column7: but Joe doesn’t think those expectations are fair to Grizzard. Liam Coen did one of the best coaching jobs Joe has seen in a while. Think about it: With a rookie center
column8: a rookie No. 3 receiver (for the most part) and a rookie running back
column9: Coen took a running attack that for two straight years was the worst in the NFL and turned it into the No. 4 running attack. That is just absurd. Then
column10: with an offense largely without Chris Godwin and three games without a Hall of Fame receiver Mike Evans
column11: the Bucs were third overall in passing (250 yards a game). That’s just nuts. Grizzard could to improve on that
column12: but those expectations are unfair for a guy calling offensive plays and running an offense for the very first time in his career. At least Coen had experience doing this in the SEC. Joe does think it is reasonable to expect Grizzard’s offense to be top-10. Those rookies should improve — if only because they have a full season of NFL football under their belts. Grizzard did spend two years as a quality control guy with Mike McDaniel. And McDaniel
column14: knows how to craft a run game. But really
column15: how much of that seeps down to a quality control coach
column16: which is what Grizzard was with McDaniel? Joe sure hopes whatever Grizzard absorbed from Coen and McDaniel is flushed out on Sundays.|2025-02-01 08:00:00|357|35|5|Josh Grizzard|Uncertain expectations for Josh Grizzard's offense in the Bucs.|8|Overall positive but with some concerns and skepticism expressed.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""Lt. column2: you may have heard. To fill the void left by the departure of Liam Coen
column4: the Bucs promoted passing game coordinator Josh Grizzard to replace him. At least two Bucs rookies seem pretty happy with the move. column5: “LFG.” So McMillen is happy. Also in the Bucs’ Instagram post

And they are spread out all across the Western Hemisphere right now so Joe is confident many are too busy living on a Friday evening and not glued to their phones.
